item.value: A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The Sun's outer layer has a temperature of 6,000C . Inside the sun the temperature is 15,000,000 C.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press in 1436 . Gutenberg is also accredited with printing the world's first book known as the Gutenberg Bible.
The longest word in a major English dictionary is 'Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis'.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high. On May 29 1953 Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay were the first to reach the peak.
A shark can hear a fish in the water from more than a mile away.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
There are more than 2,700 languages ( + more than 7,000 dialects) in the world. More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun. They are divided into two groups: the inner planets (Mercury, Venus,Earth, and Mars) and the outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto).
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
